Fields.DialogueText: Morgana patrol ahead!
@BATTLE
We've come a long way from our Mediterranean patrols. Given the work we've done in the Red Sea, nobody's complaining too strenuously, but...
It was worth it to make sure Tetesfewe was seaworthy again.
She isn't exactly what she used to be.
Part of her still lives on, in a way. I couldn't turn my back.
You had to protect a friend.
And now Command is probably unhappy with us, Tesoro.
Probably. But we've been given a lot of autonomy, and we accomplished a hell of a lot out here. Official complaints won't go very far.
Still. You risked your command to indulge me.

Fields.MenuText: It was worth it. Fighting for friends means taking risks.
I'm still not sure it was worth it.
If you're so grateful, how do you plan to make it up to me?

Fields.DialogueText: Sì. It was.
You have to trust that it was.
Let's not get ahead of ourselves, Tesoro.
Eritrea has a fighting chance now, but I know it was costly for you.
I can handle myself.
Well, enough of this. I need a cigarette. Oh, and let's set a course back to the Suez.
The canal? Is it time?
Sì. It's too quiet out here for a girl like me.
To hell and back.
Getting some fresh air?
Little chance of that here. Give me your lighter so I can light my cigarette.
As long as I get that lighter back.
Of course. I wonder, Tesoro, am I conspicuous out here?

Fields.MenuText: You know the answer to that. I still catch some of the crew stealing glances at our glamorous Belle.
If you're asking whether the ship looks like a worn-out relic from the old world, my answer is a polite "maybe."
You would always stand out in a crowd.

Fields.DialogueText: Ha! Hardly what I meant, Tesoro, but I appreciate that.
Ouch!
That's sweet of you to say, but we probably look a bit worse for wear.
The sandstorms have taken a toll on my looks.
I'll have the crew get to work. A touch of new paint could go a long way.
I was hoping you'd do that for me.
No problem. Besides, the crew needs something to keep them from getting restless.
I know a better cure for that. Maybe a raid would perk them up.
Why do I get the feeling you know something I don't?
Only because I looked off the port bow before you did.
Incoming Morganas... all hands to battle stations!
@BATTLE
No love for the fishermen? That's the third trawler you almost ran over and wrecked.
We maneuvered to avoid a collision in plenty of time. You complain too much.

Fields.MenuText: Slow it down. We're not killing any civilians on my watch.
A warship always has the right of way. The fishing boats will understand.
Who knew that terrorizing local fishing boats could be so fun?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm built for speed. One of my finer qualities, Tesoro, in case you hadn't noticed.
You remembered the war? You'd make a great capitano someday.
Very funny. I save terror for my enemies, Tesoro.
Keep it under control, Espero.
Calling me a bad driver?
Not exactly, just a dangerous one.
You never learned how to pay a woman a compliment, did you?
@BATTLE
What is it, mio Tesoro? You should know that I just started burning a cigarette.
I'm more concerned about how much fuel we're burning.
We will make it to our destination.
I don't want to run out of gas in the Red Sea.
I said that we will make it. Trust me.

Fields.MenuText: Why are you running so fast to the canal?
What are you afraid of out here?
Steal something from the local police?

Fields.DialogueText: Would you rather be an easy prize for the Morganas?
Afraid? You misunderstand.
Of course not! Well, actually...
These waters are crawling with Morganas. Those Cattive Ragazze will pounce on us if we don't move with a purpose.
Discussing that "purpose" is something we haven't quite gotten around to yet, Espero.
The time isn't right. Let's just get through the canal first.
"The time isn't right," she says. Yeah, that's not ominous at all.
Ha! Tesoro, you...
Don't blame me. It was probably all the angry fishermen...
Silenzio!
@BATTLE
Old habits, eh?
Let's change the subject.
Merda! Here they come. You shouldn't have distracted me.
Time to talk, Espero.
After I finish my cigarette.
You can talk and smoke at the same time.
Stop distracting me.
You've done a great job evading Morganas, but you won't get away from me so easily.
Shh! Time to focus. We'll be at the entrance to the canal soon.

Fields.MenuText: I know that sly smile. I'm not taking us into that canal until you talk.
You can trust me. What's the big hurry?
Come to think of it, you are pretty boring conversation.

Fields.DialogueText: Fine!
*sigh*
All right! Enough!
I need us to hurry back to Alexandria. We're running out of time.
Better, but not good enough. Spit it out, Espero.
I have a contact waiting for us there. They're holding something valuable for me. For us.
And is this something I can expect to cause us moral or legal difficulties?
It isn't like that at all. Trust me.
Get this out of your head and get some rest. I need you ready for the war.
*ALARM*
The war is ready for us right now.
Damn! This conversation isn't finished, Espero.
I know.
@BATTLE
Morganas on the horizon!
@BATTLE
Got you where I want you.
Who knew you were such a romantic, Tesoro?
It's quiet here. Plenty of time for us to talk while we transit.
Don't distract me. We're vulnerable here in the canal, and I have to pay attention.
Our lookouts are doing their jobs. Focus on me.
Fine.
Now, about this mad dash to Alexandria...
My contact there is waiting for us with a package. We don't have much time.
Your contact? What's he holding?
She is going to sell us something. Something important.

Fields.MenuText: As your Captain, I deserve to know everything.
I like that gleam in your eye. Say no more, Espero. I'm in.
Is "sell" just code for "you're going to steal it"?

Fields.DialogueText: Direct as ever. I suppose you are right.
Aw, why give in so easily? I was starting to enjoy making you work for it.
Stop teasing me, Tesoro.
A priceless scroll from the Ancient Library of Alexandria, hundreds of years old, suddenly became...available.
Even for you, making money off stolen relics is low.
That's not my goal, Tesoro. You should know me better than that.
Well, you do like to borrow things–permanently–without permission.
I do enjoy taking souvenirs, but this is different. This scroll may unlock secrets to an advantage over the Morganas.
No tricks? This is real?
I'm asking you to gamble that it is. That it could be.
I need to think about this, Espero.
Sì, of course, but don't take long. Time is short.
How, exactly? And according to whom?
Whispers from the Vatican, Tesoro. The scroll is thought to have something to do with the "Sea Peoples" who attacked ancient Egypt - and with the civilizational collapse late in the Bronze Age.
Perhaps it has to do with an earlier wave of Morganas, lost to most history. Perhaps it's about a weapon. All I know is that it's a prize.
We're coming out of the Suez. Helm, engines all ahead flank.
Aye-aye, Captain.
Let's go! I can't wait to be free of this tiny canal and feel the wind again.
Up in the rigging? You're sure you want to be perched up there when we cruise at thirty-nine knots?
Glamorous, sì? You should come up here with me and try it.
I think I'll pass, this time. Just make sure you hang on tight when we start to speed up.
Don't fret over me. I'm good at hanging on tightly, Tesoro.
You're quite a sight. You sound so happy.
Perhaps I'm just glad that you're as excited to hurry to Alexandria as I am.
I'm not thinking about Alexandria right now.
Oh? What's on your mind then?

Fields.MenuText: Well...
Just enjoying the view.
I was thinking you should let your hair down to clean all that dirty sand out of it.

Fields.DialogueText: Out with it.
Is that all?
If you ever think about becoming a poet, remind me to discourage you.
I'm also thinking about those Morganas astern, chasing us down in the canal.
Cattive Ragazze? Merda! We don't have time for this!
Get back to the engine room and push harder, Espero. We need that top speed as fast as you can give it.
You'll have it soon...but you have my guns right now.
@BATTLE
How close are we? Did you ask the Navigator?
It won't be long. And leave the Navigator alone - you've pestered him enough.
I don't understand why he doesn't like me.
You stole his favorite pencil.
Ah, right, I suppose I did.
The crew is starting to get anxious. They know we're in a hurry, but they don't know why.
Don't tell the crew about the scroll or about anything else.

Fields.MenuText: I'm not the kind of captain who lies to his crew.
They're risking their lives, too. Why keep them in the dark?
We can't let details of our mission spread. Keeping them ignorant is the best move.

Fields.DialogueText: You aren't lying to them. You're keeping them safe.
We can't have our plan be discovered by the wrong forces.
It is necessary to keep them in the dark for now.
We have no choice, Tesoro, but to keep this to ourselves. Imagine what would happen if the Cattive Ragazze found out.
I understand. This is tough enough even without racing every Morgana group in the Mediterranean.
Precisamente.
Anything else?
Just one. Can you go ask the Navigator how close we are now?
Espero...
@BATTLE
At long last. We're at the coordinates.
Small vessel approaching! No flag or markings, just two black pennants on the mast.
Looks like a smuggler. Ready the guns for a warning shot.
Don't shoot! Let that boat come closer.

Fields.MenuText: Don't worry, Espero. I was just keeping up appearances for the crew.
Are you certain that's your contact with the scroll?
I'm keeping the guns ready.

Fields.DialogueText: I appreciate that, Tesoro.
See those two black pennants on the mast? That's her.
Go ahead, but you won't need them.
Now the smuggler boat has turned around. It's heading away!
That boat was getting closer...but now she's leaving?
Look in the water. See that crate?
Ah. She jettisoned that before she turned to go.
That must be our scroll. Bring it aboard!
Lookout, send a team to recover that crate.
Aye-aye, Captain.
Hurry!
Relax. We finally have what we came for.
We aren't the only ones. Were we followed here?
Morganas approaching from all sides, Captain!
It's a damn ambush. What did you get us into, Espero?
I swear I had nothing to do with them turning up!
@BATTLE
Get inside and lock the door.
All right. Is it just the two of us in here?
We are alone, I assure you. I wouldn't trust anybody else in my cabin but you, Tesoro.
It's cozy in here. Is that the crate?
What other crate did we almost die to recover? Yes, of course this is the crate.
Forget I asked.
Help me pry this open.

Fields.MenuText: Let's hope this isn't a booby trap.
Allow me.
It's your crate. Open it yourself.

Fields.DialogueText: Perish the thought, Tesoro.
É una cosa genial di te.
Fine. This Belle is not afraid to get her hands dirty.
1... 2... 3! There. What's inside?
A leather case?
Be careful opening that. If the scroll is as old as they say, it will be brittle.
I'm unrolling it now. It's... bizarre.
Give me that. I see writing on it, but I am not sure what language that is. Such strange drawings and diagrams, too.
That looks like a table, maybe an altar? They're mixing ingredients in a big cauldron below it. Some of the figures in these drawings look...
Diabolico...
...like Morganas.
*ALARM*
I'll go deal with that.
Leaving my room so soon?
Take your time and figure out that scroll for me.
Aye aye, Tesoro.
This better be worth it.
@BATTLE
I'm well aware of that.
Espero?
Come in, Tesoro.
I'm back. That last skirmish with the Morganas was a piece of cake.
You dispatched those Cattive Raggaze quickly. Eager to get back into my room?
Knock it off, Espero. We need to get cracking on that scroll.
Oh, you don't have to pretend. I know you missed me.
Can we talk about the scroll, please?
I've studied it carefully. I think the drawings and writings describe a ritual.
How so?
Look at this picture. The people are standing around a cauldron mixing some sort of recipe. This dark angel above the cauldron is engulfed in flames.
That dark angel looks sinister, like a Morgana.

Fields.MenuText: It's probably bogus. Some creepy old pictures don't really mean anything.
This could be a formula for a weapon that could destroy them.
There's something evil about the whole thing. This could actually be instructions for how to make a Morgana.

Fields.DialogueText: If you knew how difficult it was for me to procure this scroll, you wouldn't say that.
That's the same feeling I get from looking at this scroll.
I...I never considered that possibility.
I am convinced that this scroll is important. It would explain the increase in Morgana activity that we've seen here in the Mediterranean.
This is a pretty big hunch, Espero. You'll have to keep working on it.
I will. Try to keep things quiet so that I can concentrate.
I'll make sure you aren't disturbed. Get back to work in there.
I wonder if—
*ALARM*
AGHHH!
@BATTLE
Morganas on our tail!
@BATTLE
Move aside, please. I need to get into the radio room.
That's not a great idea.
Sei serio? I am the Belle, in case you had forgotten. I will move about this ship as I please.
If this is about the, uh, thing we were discussing earlier, we need to be discreet.
We have to take the risk, Tesoro. I'm going to radio Command and request some assistance.
I need a scholar or a translator. I know many languages, but the writing on the, as you say, thing, is in one that I can't decipher.

Fields.MenuText: It's too risky to talk about this ancient scroll over the radio.
Maybe we have somebody on board who can read it.
Do it. It's worth taking a chance.

Fields.DialogueText: We don't have any options. This is too important.
I have already asked around. Nobody can.
I'll be discreet.
Then go for it.
You trust me?
Go for it. We've invested a lot in this scroll, and I mean to see just what it can do for the war effort.
What is it?
Non importa. I'll let you know when I'm done.
Nice of you to join me, mio Tesoro.
It's beautiful up here.
The Mediterranean has its charms, sì.
And it's nice to not be running all the time.
This is only the calm before the storm, I fear.
Fear? That's a new one for you.
I am concerned about the reply from Command.
You radioed your request for a translator?
I did. The response was unsettling.
What did they say?
Nothing. Can you believe that? They told me to wait.

Fields.MenuText: It's your imagination. Everything will work out fine.
You're right to be worried. Command might say that we're crazy and call us back to port.
You think that's a bad reaction?

Fields.DialogueText: I hope you are right. Thank you for trying to reassure me.
That would be terrible. All of that effort for nothing.
They hardly reacted at all! For something this important, that troubles me.
I believe in you. Besides, all we can do now is wait for an answer.
Sì. I suppose that means it's time for another cigarette.
*ALARM*
Merda.
Is it just me, or are these Morgana attacks getting more frequent?
My guns worry about one fight at a time.
@BATTLE
Still waiting?
Yes, damn it all. Still no answer from Command.
They're busy fighting the war, I suppose.
I keep thinking about that, too. And what comes after. What will happen to us?
You mean after the fighting stops?
Precisamente. What do we become after that?

Fields.MenuText: We'll find something better to do than chase Morganas all day long.
If I can drive a ship, maybe I could drive a taxi after the war. I'll be a taxi driver, and you could be the taxi cab's Belle.
We'll be the same. No matter what, you'll be my Belle and I'll be your Tesoro.

Fields.DialogueText: You make it sound so simple.
Ridicolo! Haha! Grazie, Tesoro. I needed that.
How sentimental of you.
Why are you looking at me like that?
I was just thinking. We've been through a lot together so far.
We aren't done yet.
*ALARM*
Not by a long shot.
@BATTLE
It is. You find what's important to you, and you keep it close.
You don't like that idea?
I didn't say that.
I heard you were on the radio with Command.
Come on in, Espero. Put these headphones on.
Any news yet?
They just told me to stand by. You didn't miss anything.
Bene. Now scoot over so I can sit next to you.
*static* Captain of Espero, this is Command. Alpha X-Ray November One. I repeat, Alpha X-Ray November One. Do you copy?
Roger, Command. Copy all.
Good luck, Captain. Command, out.
*CLICK*
*STATIC*
Damn.
Cosa ti hanno detto?
That was a priority code from the top brass.
Are they sending help?
No... They told us to run for our lives.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Damage report!
The fires topside and in the engine room have been extinguished. Teams are working to patch hull damage at frame 42 and frame 47.
Are you all right, Espero?
You worry about me too much. I have taken worse, mio Tesoro.

Fields.MenuText: Of all the bad luck...fine time for us to hit a Morgana convoy like that.
The Morganas know about us. We've been compromised.
I'm just glad you're okay.

Fields.DialogueText: Was it just bad luck?
Do you think they know about the scroll?
It will take more than that to put me down for good.
They know we have something important. If it wasn't our call to Command, maybe our smuggler gave us up.
She is trustworthy. She would not have done so willingly.
With the Morganas actively searching for us, this scroll could get us killed. They won't stop hunting us as long as we have it.
But we still don't know how to make the recipe in the scroll's pictures.
Until we figure this all out, we need to keep moving and dodge the Morganas.
Then it's a good thing I'm fast.
Let's hope our luck holds out.
@BATTLE
Enemy spotted to the east!
@BATTLE
Shut the door behind you and explain this plan to me again.
It is simple. We need the right ingredients to make the mixture shown on the scroll.
But we don't know what the ingredients are, do we?
That's the good news. I was able to figure out some of the symbols.
I didn't know you could speak wizard.
That scroll isn't a magic spell, it's more like... chimica.
Chemistry, alchemy, whatever it is... what do we need?
I made this list of the elements and compounds. Some we have on board, but others we will have to acquire... aggressively.
Meaning?
We intercept civilian merchant ships to get what we need.

Fields.MenuText: This is starting to sound like piracy. I don't want to cross that line.
If that's what it takes.
Are you sure this isn't just an excuse for you to indulge your kleptomania?

Fields.DialogueText: You can't be serious about that. This could end the war.
We aren't pirates. We're doing this to save our people.
Maybe we can hijack a freighter full of jokes, too. It appears some of us are in dire need.
No other options, are there?
None that I can see.
So be it.
Thank you, Tesoro. If I'm wrong and this scroll is a hoax, then I'll turn myself in after we fail. Does that make you feel better?
No. Actually, I think that just made me feel worse.
I know, I know.
Just a bit of gallows humor, Espero.
I know. I am as anxious about this as you are
Damn! The Aegean is teeming with Morgana patrols. You could cross the sea by walking across them like lily pads.
The Cattive Ragazze are everywhere out here.
I'm tempted to have one of those cigarettes of yours while I think about this.
I suppose I'm in a sharing mood. If you'd like, I'd even light it for you.
Heh, thanks, Espero. Do you really think you can find what we need?
We'll have to try for a merchant without drawing Morgana attention.

Fields.MenuText: We could creep into a harbor at night and sneak aboard a moored merchant that has what we need.
We could go into a port guns blazing. The element of surprise might give us an edge.
We could look for a weak spot in the patrols, then hope that we find a suitable target there.

Fields.DialogueText: Risky, but I don't see any other way for us to get what we need.
The merchants would scatter, and our odds of surviving would be slim with so many Morganas about.
We could, but the chances of us finding what we need would be virtually zero.
Then we'll have to pick a port and then try to enter unnoticed.
We should try for Napoli.
Naples it is. Plot our course.
At once, but we will have to cross that small Morgana convoy first.
Let's make this quick.
@BATTLE
These Morgana patrols just get worse and worse.
We're losing time with all of this weaving and circling around. I prefer a straight sprint.
I know, but the more we try to get past them, the tighter they box us in.
It's... uncanny.
I hope the recipe on that scroll pays off.
It will. I am confident it will lead to an advantage over the Morganas.

Fields.MenuText: I'll bet it has information on something that can permanently hurt them, like Greek fire.
I can't help thinking it's a clue to where the Morganas come from.
Honestly, I can't imagine how a dusty scroll is going to help me right now.

Fields.DialogueText: The recipe for Greek fire has been lost for over a millennium. Who can say what it would do to a Morgana?
A foul pit somewhere, for all I care. This scroll must be a recipe for a way to kill them. Why else would they hunt us so relentlessly?
Let's just concentrate on getting to Naples.
Besides, that scroll showed a dark angel burning to ash. It must be a weapon.
Keep your ears open. I want to know as soon as we catch word that a freighter with our raw materials is near the port.
Guess what we need to take care of first, Tesoro?
Don't tell me...
@BATTLE
Another cup of coffee?
Ah, yes. Thanks for taking good care of me. Did I look so tired?
Esausto, Tesoro.
Then I look how I feel. I'm barely keeping my eyes open.
The Morganas didn't give us a break, but we're outside Naples and waiting for our target. You did it.
It's not over yet.
Tesoro! Off the port beam!
Let me focus these binoculars first. Wait...Is that what I think it is?
From her markings, she's hauling potassium cyanide and ammonium nitrate.
Bingo! She must be full of it, too. Look at how low she's riding in the water.
And already pulling away from the harbor!
So much for sneaking aboard nice and easy while she's at anchor.

Fields.MenuText: Fire a warning shot, and maybe she'll stop for us.
Let's follow her out, slowly.
This seems too easy.

Fields.DialogueText: And bring Morganas down on our heads? I advise against that so close to the harbor.
Aye aye, Tesoro.
It feels dangerous to me, too, but do we even have a choice?
I'll follow her until she's away from the harbor. We'll take her in the open sea.
I don't want anybody on board to get hurt, us or them, so let's keep this under control.
She's speeding up and turning to evade us.
Damn! What spooked her?
Them.
Morganas closing in from both sides.
@BATTLE
Did we finish loading everything?
That barrel should be the last one, Tesoro.
And we did it without having to hurt the crew of that freighter that we stopped. Requisitioning these chemicals from them was regrettable, but we had no choice.
It is fortunate for us, and for them, that they complied so readily.

Fields.MenuText: They were persuaded by the determination in our eyes.
They were persuaded by the determination in our 120mm guns pointed right at them.
They were persuaded by the beautiful ghost lady that floats around our ship in a tight dress.

Fields.DialogueText: Your face does look fearsome when you have your mind set on something, Tesoro.
I would not have fired upon them unless we had no other choice.
If only it was so easy to get what I wanted from you, Tesoro.
Don't lose focus now. These barrels are highly flammable.
I don't like the possibility that a lucky Morgana shell could turn us into a fireball.
Then we'd better get somewhere safer as fast as we can.
I am already preparing our engines for a speedy departure.
Let's clear out of here. We won't have a chance to make the scroll's recipe if we're constantly fighting Morganas.
If we can break through this group, we might have a clear run to the strait.
@BATTLE
Then I'm grateful it didn't come to that.
Those Morgana shells are landing too close for comfort!
I am running at flank speed, Tesoro.
They want to trap us. They're trying to keep us from escaping through the Strait of Gibraltar.
Those Cattive Ragazza know we have something dangerous on board. They fear it!

Fields.MenuText: Keep going. Give me all the speed you have.
We're running out of chances.
Then why am I the one who feels so scared?

Fields.DialogueText: You have it, but I don't know for how long.
Don't lose hope, Tesoro.
Either way, it will be over soon.
If the Morganas know we have an ancient scroll that can make a superweapon, they'll keep chasing us with everything they've got.
Then I hope Command got our message.
I think it's just us out here. We're going to have to finish this alone.
You're not alone. I'm here with you.
@BATTLE
No sign of that armada that's coming over the horizon any second now to rescue us?
Sadly, no. We tried to radio a message to Command with our situation, but we didn't get a reply.
No rescue for us, then.
No.
The Morganas are making another run at us. They're coming full force!
@BATTLE
They'll be back once they regroup. We put up an amazing fight, but their next attack will finish us off.
Then this is it. We have to put the scroll in a watertight safe in your cabin and radio our location to Command. After we go down, divers can recover the scroll from our wreckage.

Fields.MenuText: Not so fast. I won't give up yet.
Command won't even get our message. What's the use?
We still have those chemicals in our storage tanks.

Fields.DialogueText: This isn't giving up, Tesoro. This is the only way to keep fighting when we're gone.
Then we have to hope they can find our wreck anyway. I'll make my last push to the shallowest spot I can find.
Are you serious?
I'm not going to ignore those tanks full of chemicals. They may not be mixed according to the scroll's recipe, but they are the right raw materials.
Impossible.
We can dump the barrels overboard, making a small minefield, and then shoot the barrels when the Morganas drive over them.
Tesoro, we worked so hard to get this far. I need time to figure out how to mix the chemicals properly so that we don't just throw them away like this.
We ran out of time for that. Now you have your orders. Get your guns ready. I'm going aft to start pushing barrels overboard.
More Morganas...
@BATTLE
Damn, these barrels are heavy.
*CLUNK*
And flammable, too. This is probably more likely to kill me than work, but I have to try.
What are you doing down there?
Just stay up there and stand by with those guns, Espero!
We don't have much time before the Morganas come back.
Just need one barrel. Oof! Got it.
*SPLASH*
Morganas coming over the horizon!
Then they're close enough to watch me throw the scroll overboard, too. I just wish that barrel wasn't so close.
*SPLASH*
I'm coming down there.
Stay where you are, Espero. I need you in the bridge.
What are you doing?!
Espero, no time to explain. Target that barrel and fire!
Did I just see you throw the scroll overboard?! I'm jumping in after it!
No! Fire on that barrel!
That will destroy the scroll, too! The formula for the secret weapon!
Do it! FIRE!
*BANG*
Great shot!
*HOWL*
Whoa! Black flames are rising up from the explosion! And that howling noise! What sort of power was in that old scroll? It's...unholy.
You... you weren't making a minefield at all. You came down here to destroy the scroll.
Look! The Morganas are turning away.
I don't understand...
It was the only thing that could save us. The scroll is gone, and the Morganas have had enough for one day. Now move over so I can collapse.
Tesoro!
Capitano?
If I told you the doctors said I wasn't ready to see visitors, you wouldn't listen anyways, would you?
Ah, mio Tesoro, you look...well.
You don't have to pull punches. I know I look rough, but I'll recover. Are you all right? When those chemicals exploded amidships...
It hurts, but yes, this ship will recover, too.
I'm relieved to hear it, Espero.
The scroll, it's really gone?
Tossed overboard and blasted to bits with one of our 120mm guns.
That could have been our last chance to—
I couldn't let them destroy you.
What?
You heard me. Maybe the brass at Command will be disappointed, but I couldn't let the Morganas destroy you.
You did it... for me?
Maybe I could sacrifice myself for a long shot like that, but I couldn't bring myself to sacrifice you. We had no guarantee that following the scroll's instructions would benefit our cause.
Oh, Tesoro, I didn't want to lose you, either! By the time I realized what you meant to me, I thought it was too late. I didn't know how to stop it.
Well, I'm still here.
And you have no idea how happy that makes me. I truly care for you, mio Tesoro.
What do we do now?
I can't stay here long. I suppose I should make sure damage control is taking care of the ship.
Do two things for me before you go.
Anything, Tesoro.
A kiss.
That's an order I would never refuse. What is the second thing?
Promise to hurry back to me.
I promise, cuore mio.
